note: Emission factors can vary depending on factors such as the efficiency of vehicle used; packing/loading density of freight etc.
title: Greenhouse emissions per unit of food transported
subtitle:
The amount of greenhouse gases emitted by transporting one tonne of food over a distance of one kilometer. 
This is measured in carbon dioxide equivalents (CO₂eq) – the warming impact of all greenhouse gases over 100 years.
sourceDesc: Ecoinvent v3.3, as applied in Poore and Nemecek (2018)
